Great contributions, hellboy. First time I'm getting a fully fledged FRAPS. The 30 secs per take doesn't cut it.
Neither do the file sizes, ironically. 30 sec vids already rack up 2GB, gonna have to apply compression, since it seems to record only in avi format.

To those who make a point of keeping updated: what is the goddamn difference? Unless previous versions actually don't cut it for you, stick with what you got for a while. Sure, look for an update when 3.3.0 is out, but are you gonna break your balls over 3.3.7-3.3.8?
Either way, hellboy will pamper us... and both you and I thank him for it.

Fraps 3.3.0 - 22nd Feb 2011
- Full support for Windows 7 SP1
- Added option to only capture external sound input while hotkey pushed (Vista/Win7)
- Fixed stereoscopic 3D capture not working for D3D9 games
- Fixed counter not appearing in Dungeons
